sections.content_preview: XMS (eXtensible management system)                                                                                                  XMS is a robust and modular business management platform  designed t...
sections.full_content:
XMS (eXtensible management system)                                                                                               
 
XMS is a robust and modular business management platform  designed to 
streamline enterprise operations. The system provides a standardized user 
interface  to efficiently manage various business -related entities while allowing 
organizations to define and conf igure rules dynamically.  
ÔÇ∑ API-Driven Architecture : The entire system is powered by RESTful APIs, 
ensuring seamless integration with external applications.  
ÔÇ∑ Modular Design : Each functionality is encapsulated as a self-contained module , 
making it highly custom izable and scalable.  
ÔÇ∑ Business Rule Automation : Organizations can define and enforce business rules 
with minimal effort, improving operational efficiency.  
ÔÇ∑ User -Friendly Interface : The intuitive UI simplifies navigation and enhances

techniques to analyze real -time social media data and categorize it into different 
smart city dimensions.  
ÔÇ∑ Data Collection : Extracts real -time posts from Twitter's live streaming API . 
ÔÇ∑ Text Processing & Classification : Uses machine learning and NLP models  to 
classify posts based on sma rt city parameters such as traffic, environment, public 
safety, and infrastructure.  
ÔÇ∑ Data Visualization : Implements interactive dashboards  to represent categorized 
posts and provide insights for city planning.  
ÔÇ∑ Impact : Helps city officials and policymakers u nderstand public concerns and 
make data -driven decisions to improve urban living conditions

Limbo Software Solutions (May 2023 ‚Äì Present)

Developed a real-time analytics dashboard using React to track transaction KPIs, issuer decline trends, acquirer health, and fraud detection indicators to enable proactive risk management leading to a 15% faster issue resolution.
Built backend APIs (RESTful) using Node.js and managed analytical datasets with MongoDB.
Conducted in-depth data analysis to define key metrics and fraud detection rules driving dashboard insights and operational decisions.
Created interactive dashboards using Plotly and Recharts to help finance, risk, and operations teams monitor platform health.
Developed an automatic settlement system that reduced manual reconciliation effort by 40%, accelerating financial close processes.

sections.content_preview: Role: Backend Engineer (May 2024 ‚Äì Present) Architected and developed a layered backend system using Go (Gin), supporting 2DS/3DS payment flows (both S2S and iFrame modes), processing up to 3000+ tran...
sections.full_content:
Role: Backend Engineer (May 2024 ‚Äì Present)
Architected and developed a layered backend system using Go (Gin), supporting 2DS/3DS payment flows (both S2S and iFrame modes), processing up to 3000+ transactions/day in high-risk verticals.
Modeled optimized MySQL schemas with GORM, ensuring referential integrity and efficient reconciliation logic. Built high-performance REST APIs. Scaled system to handle 500+ concurrent requests using Go routines and optimized DB queries.
Developed merchant onboarding and profiling logic to classify transactions as FTD/trusted using transaction history, heuristics, and device fingerprinting, helping reduce fraud and repeat abuse patterns.
Engineered secure, PCI-compliant flows including webhooks, callbacks, and data handling across the transaction lifecycle. 
Built structured logging pipelines for transaction lifecycle tracking (request/response, retries, failures) reducing transaction failure rate by 35%.
Collaborated with frontend teams to deliver React-based dashboards (admin & merchant) for transaction tracking, log visibility, and performance metrics.
Integrated multiple global acquirer banks with dynamic MID-based routing. Prototyping an AI/ML-driven acquirer selection engine to boost approval rates and routing efficiency.

Client  : Cigna

Environment  : Golang, Go modules ,go Gin , Mongo DB, AWS s3 , Rest services, vscode.

UM status tracker used to get  info of Authrization and Appeal system information. It has 5 consumers  
and 2 producers. Producers could insert the both Authorization and appeal cases into the Mongo DB by Golang rest 
services.  Providers and users can access the both Authorization and Appeal cases by unique Id.   
 
RESPONSIBILITIES : 
 
‚Ä¢ Design, develop and Deploy microservices using Golang 1.19 ,  Gin ,EKS, EC2 instance, S3 . 
‚Ä¢ Involved in Interaction with Business team in story grooming, reviewing story/acceptance criteria and  
reviewing UI design.  
‚Ä¢ Design and analyze the existing No -SQL Database system to support microservices architecture and improve the 
product scalability, Extensibility, and Reduce operational burden.  
‚Ä¢ Participate in the Agile sprint planning discussion to groom the user stories and help the Business Team to covert 
the Functionalities into user stories and defining the User acceptance.  
‚Ä¢ Involve in the DevOps automation to support continuous delivery and continuous integration processes.

‚Ä¢ Testing the web services using Postman.

application. Used  Bamboo for  continuous integration (CI)  and continuous deployment (CD)  pipeline.

‚Ä¢ Created a release tag and deployed into SIT, UAT, PreProd and Prod environments  
‚Ä¢ Maintained the AWS K8 cluster for deploying the docker images.  
‚Ä¢ Involved in POC (Proof of Concept) and spike stories in JIRA to demonstrate the solution to the Business  
users‚Äô group and to improve the system cost savings.
